title: High Carbon Dioxide Damage Impact
description: In 2020, Syria's adjusted savings due to carbon dioxide damage accounted for 9.85% of its GNI, indicating significant environmental challenges.

title: Lowest Political Stability
description: Syria's political stability estimate in 2023 was -2.75, reflecting ongoing challenges with violence and terrorism.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Tertiary Education
description: In 2015, Syria had a pupil-teacher ratio of 64.41 in tertiary education, indicating potential challenges in educational quality.

title: Significant Merchandise Exports to MENA
description: In 2023, 58.07% of Syria's merchandise exports were directed to low- and middle-income economies in the Middle East & North Africa.

title: Minimal Public Debt Burden
description: In 2020, Syria's public and publicly guaranteed debt service was just 0.00002% of its GNI, indicating a low debt burden.

title: High Youth Population
description: In 2023, 11.66% of Syria's male population and 11.38% of its female population were aged 20-24, highlighting a significant youth demographic.

title: Low Government Consumption Growth
description: In 2022, Syria experienced a -49.42% growth in general government final consumption expenditure, indicating economic challenges.

title: Minimal Mineral Depletion Impact
description: In 2018, mineral depletion accounted for a negligible 0.00000178% of Syria's GNI, suggesting limited resource extraction.
